comments.text:
I think (based on Weegee64101's comment a week ago) that YouTube decides 
what the ads are called when it's a YouTube funded channel (feel free to 
correct me if I'm wrong, I have no idea).

And normally I'd tell you off a bit for the 'view whores' thing, but you 
have explained your reasoning behind that. Even if I don't agree with it, I 
can respect that you thought about it and came to a logical decision 
instead of just spewing bad language for no reason.
comments.author: Amy May

comments.text:
"I'm just an aggressive person."  I could agree with this, but your final 
paragraph comes off more as "pompous ass" than anything else.

First of all, there's a difference between shouting loudly (such as all 
caps, bolding text, or other things to make your text stand out) and 
shouting vulgarly (as you did).  Impassioned speech =/= aggressive speech; 
volume =/= content, so don't try to make them into the same thing.

Let me put the marketing thing in a different perspective.  If, as a 
marketer, you determine that people who like a certain show or pool of 
shows seem to also like another show or pool of shows, can you not then 
also deduce that they would be likely to like yet another show or pool of 
shows?  Even if you're not snagging a majority percentage, you can grab a 
substantial number of people.  For example, I know of a lot of people who 
like MLP and Regular Show.  Typically, the people I know or have 
encountered who like these shows also like Adventure Time.  From this, I 
could make an educated guess that they'd like Bravest Warriors and that, 
back in the day, they'd probably have enjoyed shows like Animaniacs or Ren 
& Stimpy.  So, I'd feel comfortable marketing certain kinds of shows by 
saying "Fans of [one or more of these shows], check this out!".  Yeah, it's 
not going to be everyone's cup of tea, but that doesn't mean that the 
intent behind the campaign was intentionally misleading.  Besides, if it 
catches a good number of viewers' attention (and potentially loyalty), then 
it's a marketing success regardless.  What convinced Cartoon Hangover that 
Doctor Lollipop would appeal to a fair portion of bronies (perhaps the 
irony of an overly hammy, girly-looking unicorn doctor, if they're going 
for the watches-the-show-ironically bronies?) is certainly something that 
could be debated, but I guess I'm willing to give the benefit of the doubt 
rather than pouncing on them right away.

Keep in mind that this is exactly how advertising works on the Internet in 
general.  Based on Internet activity and browsing patterns, websites and 
companies try to tailor ads to you by showing you what they think you're 
interested in.  Sometimes, they are horrendously off for one reason or 
another, but they're always following their algorithms.  Unless you just 
want to say that all modern targeted marketing is crap and to swear off 
pretty much every company you've seen a side or banner ad for ever, what 
you're saying here just comes across as overreactive, and I guess that's 
what I'm trying to say in the end.
comments.author: AJ Earthbend

comments.text:
+AJ Earthbend First off, my response was not "Everybody else does it" but 
rather "You have to be aggressive to get a point across on the internet, 
especially on youtube". You wouldn't whisper a group conversation in a busy 
New York subway station, would you? No, because the trains are noisy and 
everyone else is talking loudly, so to effectively converse with a group 
you must raise your voice. You don't raise your voice just because 
"everyone else is doing it", but rather because you have to raise your 
voice or you will be drowned out by all the other people who are doing it 
because of all the people around them who are doing it. All this is beside 
the point anyway, because nowhere in my response did I even allude to being 
aggressive because it's what everyone else is doing, in all honestly, its 
because I'm just an aggressive person.

Now, I wouldn't call deceiving your customers (and yes, we are customers, 
we pay with our time) to get more money as intelligent marketing. Would you 
say it's good marketing to advertise Vegemite as if it tasted like beer 
because it is made from leftover brewer's yeast? Of course not, because it 
doesn't taste like beer at all, and assuming that people will like it just 
because an ingredient is shared would be stupid. Hell, if anything it's bad 
marketing, because people like me who get upset when someone tries to trick 
them will stop supporting said company's products, I've added a filter in 
adblock that blocks the ads from channels that I don't want to support 
because of their business practices, and it just so happens that I had to 
add Cartoon Hangover to that list, so I wont be even be seeing them pop up 
in search result ads.

Know what you're talking about and who you are fucking with before you 
spout bullshit. Also, GOML.
comments.author: Magnum Frost

comments.text:
I like how a) your response to being called out on an unnecessarily hostile 
remark (regardless of your actual intent) was basically, "But everybody 
else does it!" and b) you have the gall to take issue with someone calling 
you out on said remark when you're pitching such a fit about the channel's 
attempts to do intelligent marketing by advertising to a specific 
demographic based on what is likely their perception (that people who watch 
MLP have similar enough tastes to want to watch this), regardless of the 
accuracy of that perception.

comments.text:
+Nosaman
Basically what I got from your comment is "It is ok to lie to people as 
long as you are getting money to live on."
...I really hope that isn't what you meant, because if so you are no better 
than the head of an investment bank who decides that he needs some more 
money and lies to screw everyone out of their hard earned cash. You might 
say "oh he had too much money in the first place, hes rich!" but my counter 
to that would be that he really is getting money to live on, its just that 
his lifestyle is vastly more extravagant than the average Joe. So, do you 
really think that deceiving people is ok as long as it pays the bills, and 
that all the homeless people who cheat/lie/steal are completely justified 
simply for the fact that they are homeless and hungry?

"Also, from an outside point of view a show about a talking candy colored 
unicorn would seem to appeal to a fan base that watches a show about 
talking candy colored ponies." You insult my intelligence if you think this 
ill contrived jumble of backwards logic would be taken seriously. Lets take 
two movies about talking penguins, for example, the movie "Happy Feet", and 
the movie "Surf's Up". Happy Feet was a funny, fairly well written, and 
entertaining movie that had pretty good pacing, while Surf's Up was a movie 
that had large amounts of forced, unfunny humor, had awful writing, was 
paced awkwardly, and got jarringly interrupted at multiple times throughout 
the movie because the writers for some reason decided that they should put 
little news-style interviews with the characters scattered throughout the 
movie like it was a reality TV show. Now, lets say you saw Happy Feet and 
absolutely loved the movie, and you joined a fan club for the movie because 
you loved it so much. You're a fan of Happy Feet now, lets just say that an 
individual fan is a self proclaimed "Happy Foot", and you stumble upon an 
ad for Surf's Up that claims to be "Happy Féét 2", or has an advertisement 
that says "Any Happy Foot should see this movie!", and you decide to go see 
the movie. Now, before I continue, I realize that this situation could 
never happen due to copyright laws, but this is a hypothetical situation in 
which the only thing you pay to see the movie is your time watching the ads 
before said movie. You are ecstatic, you devour fan works/parodies/official 
content with fervor, and you think that this new movie is related to your 
beloved Happy Feet and so you go to see the movie, sitting through the 13 
minutes worth of advertising (this video having a 30 second ad which is 
about 1/12 the length of this 6 minute video, so I made the advertising 
proportional to the 83 minute running time of Surf's Up) and realize that 
the only relation this movie has to Happy Feet is the talking 3D animated 
penguins. The bad writing of Surf's Up aside, you are angry because the 
movie made out that it was related to Happy Feet, but you are furious 
because the producers of the movie deceived and took advantage of you for a 
quick buck.

Do you see the point I'm trying to make? Also, never start out an argument 
with "from an outside point of view" as there is no such thing and it only 
makes you look arrogant and stupid by assuming that you are the only one 
with a level head even if you are neither arrogant nor stupid, not saying 
that you are, but it just makes you look that way.
comments.author: Magnum Frost

comments.author: rei migule

comments.text:
+rei migule
Not really, it's basic human nature, by defualt we are very volatile 
creatures on the inside, however, we have developed the ability to keep our 
destructive natures out of our social lives to a large extent. Honestly, I 
would say that people being able to show their nitty-gritty on the internet 
is a good thing, the only reason I say this is that it gives a good release 
and can do a very good job of keeping people from "blowing up" in the real 
world, kind of like a big stress ball that, instead of being squeezed for a 
physical comfort, is more like a mental object that your psyche can 
"squeeze". So yeah, the internet is a series of tubes *and* a metaphysical 
stress ball that can help people cool their jets if they know how to use 
it. One exclusion I would make is social networking sites like Facebook, a 
lot of studies show that the more time spent on social networking sites, 
the lower your self esteem and the more jealous of those you know you 
become. The most likely cause of the social networking problem that I can 
think of is that while the internet can be a great mental venting tool, 
what you see and do on facebook directly relates to the real world, but a 
lot of people still use it like they have total anonymity, which results in 
the shift of the hidden dangerous human nature from the background to the 
foreground. Social networking is a great tool if you can keep the mindset 
that it is a direct extension of reality. Anyway, enough rabbit trailing 
for now. Oh, and thanks for the compliment.
comments.author: Magnum Frost

+Prackin 222 
Rather than argue with you like an idiot. I'm going to give you some 
pointers on how to actually be a troll because you clearly need it.

1. Your comment lacks originality and proper punctuation. Anyone can shout 
"go away and fu#3 off". But it's only making you look stupid. You're the 
troll and it is imperative that you create the illusion that are an 
intellectual with a grudge. A better insult would have been
"Sir! I wholeheartedly disagree with you. Your opinion is worthless. Please 
vacate immediately". Notice how i used correct punctuation and big words?

2. Change your icon. Roblox is the worst game since ET and you're only 
making yourself look stupid. Change it to something  made of pure evil 
like a goblin or a cat. An intimidating icon will further the illusion of 
sophistication.

3. Your name. Again it's stupid and leads me to believe that you are stupid 
too. Much like your comment and your icon it lacks creativity. When 
selecting a troll name. Never use Numbers or symbols where they are not 
needed and never use your real name. PIck something intelligent or 
intimidating. Remember your trying to look smart not stupid.
An adequate name for you would be:
Inutile.

I know this is redundant because you probably won't read it or even 
understand most of the words i've just typed. But i still hope i've taught 
you a thing or two about how to look like an intelligent troll. Next time 
try a little harder.

comments.text:
+Johan Johaness It's similar in that it's a bunch of characters living in a 
universe that they don't take seriously most of the time. By that I mean, 
when a character sees something out of the ordinary, even for their world, 
they just shrug it off like it was nothing.

comments.text:

comments.author: Johan Johaness

comments.text:
+Zoe Papillon The problem with things like Bee and Puppycat and Bravest

eyes. The humor is very very similar, and series like these would mix it up 
a little,

comments.text:

fantasy surgery and occasionally a new character but I do suppose its 
better to leave people wanting more right? :)

captions.text: La la la la, la la, la la la la... My! What big eyes you have! The better to... MACE YOU WITH! Just need to shake it up.
Oh, hey man... Do you want some? There's cold cuts, fresh baked pie... This relish is home made, I think. It's great!

RRRRAAAAAWWWARRRAAAAWWW. Ruh Rah rah rah.
Aw nuts!

Hmmhmmmhhhm
Ruh rah ah rah

How long have you been like
this?
Well that is not good

Afternoon...I'm Dr Lollipop.
What's wrong with him?

No clue.
Right. Birderlies, his chart

Mr. Rawwwwrrrghhhahhrrahaharrraaarraaar rrrrra
May I call you Mr. Rawr?

Raaarrraar?
Please, Mr. Popcorn Gumball Sprinkles is my

father. You may call me...
Dr Lollipop! ...or Dr LOL, but only on weekends...

My gut tells me to listen to YOUR gut. Birderlies?
Help me! It's so dark...

If I can just make it through the
large intestines, I'll be free.

You're not cool.
Don't be a hero.

Neighhh... I have made my diagnosis. You have
rumblies in your tumblies.

Mr. Rawr, the reason for your persistent tummy
aches is a direct result of your diet... Talking

animals wreak havoc on the digestive system.
Judging from your

current state, i'd say you've eaten quite
a few.
Rawwrrraaahhrrrarrrghhhh...

Sh, sh, sh, sh, sh... This doctor
prescribes... EMERGENCY SURGERY!

Not to worry...
For I am no...ordinary

unicorn...I am a...
UNICORN DOCTOR!

Nurse Crackers?
Yes, doctor?

Prepare for surgery!
Oh goodie, will I be using the bird anesthetic?...or

reptile?
Paleontologists have debated that subject.

Mr. Rawr, no snacks for you before surgery.
Hahahahaha.
But there WILL be snacks for us...

Coco, bring in the snack tray.
SUPER MAGICAL RRRRAINBOWWW KICK!

Nurse Crackers, fetch me my
surgical tools!
Birderlies, I need you to go get Dr. You Know Who. JUST GO.

Now, I need you to know, this is a very delicate
surgery... hooves were not fashioned for the
type of incision work needed.

Therefore, I've called for an extra pair
of hands...

Let's cut this turkey open
COCO!! WHAT THINKING?!

You're only a resident
Right.
May I introduce... Dr. Woodsman. 
Oh my.

Oh that man is crazy handsome!
That's no man... That's a DOCTOR!

Yeah, whatever... He's very attractive...
NOT like he's a unicorn!
Now...what seems to be the...Flapjacks and Sassafras!
That carnivorous crecetaceaus cassowary is full of woodland dwellers!

Oh look... you brought your friend, Dr Obvious...
and he brought his friend Dr. Funfactsaboutdinosaurs.

And you brought YOUR friend...Dr Hasahorn!
Dr Obvious, living up to his name...

DR LOLLIPOP...living up to his name...which
is DR LOLLIPOP...

Birderlies, scrub us up!
Just prick your finger on this

anesthesia needle and count backwards from
100...

ROOORRRWW! (in pain)
The crystal ball reads that his

vitals are stable.
LET'S GET MEDICAL!

Dr Woodsman, commence with the
incision!

What's happening?! Someone just almost chopped
my hand off! I'm so scared.

We're gonna die in the belly of
this beast!!

Dr Woodsman, what's wrong?
There's wittle animals in
there. What if I hurt them?

We have to act now or we will lose this
raptor! 
His vitals are slipping! Dr

Woodsman...do something!!
Screw those lovable

woodlanders!!
FINISH THE JOB, MAN! This is a hack job!

Well, I DO hack for a living...
We are losing him!!

THAT'S IT!! Mr Rawr, allow me to
stomp your guts out!
SUPER MAGICAL RAINBOW--- KICK!

Open your eyes, Mr Rawr.
How do you feel?
Heddo wittle squirrlley whirley...

Ewww... I can't believe I liked you.
Mr Rawr, I understand you've recently immigrated

here .. but you're
having trouble adapting.
We have some informative... pamphlets... "Learning to Speak

Mammal" and "Who Not To Eat: A Carnivore's
Guide to Magical Creatures" "Carnivore's

Guide to Eating Animals: If they be a talkin'
you keep a walkin'"

Well team, another medical miracle... Until
the next time the sick come a callin'...

Oh no... 
...or defenseless animals get a

maulin'...
Don't do the thing right now...
This is... DR LOLLIPOP!
Hangover!
